name: CopyJob
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
CopyJob
description:
CopyJob

A Job subclass representing a copy operation that may be performed on a Table. A CopyJob instance is created when you call Table#copy_job.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
table = dataset.table "my_table"
destination_table = dataset.table "my_destination_table"

copy_job = table.copy_job destination_table

copy_job.wait_until_done!
copy_job.done? #=> true

methods.name: source
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
CopyJob#source
methods.description: The table from which data is copied. This is the table on which Table#copy_job was called.

methods.name: destination
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
CopyJob#destination
methods.description: The table to which data is copied.

methods.name: create_if_needed?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
CopyJob#create_if_needed?
methods.description: Checks if the create disposition for the job is CREATE_IF_NEEDED, which provides the following behavior: If the table does not exist, the copy operation creates the table. This is the default create disposition for copy jobs.

methods.name: create_never?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
CopyJob#create_never?
methods.description: Checks if the create disposition for the job is CREATE_NEVER, which provides the following behavior: The table must already exist; if it does not, an error is returned in the job result.

methods.name: write_truncate?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
CopyJob#write_truncate?
methods.description: Checks if the write disposition for the job is WRITE_TRUNCATE, which provides the following behavior: If the table already exists, the copy operation overwrites the table data.

methods.name: write_append?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
CopyJob#write_append?
methods.description: Checks if the write disposition for the job is WRITE_APPEND, which provides the following behavior: If the table already exists, the copy operation appends the data to the table.

methods.name: write_empty?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
CopyJob#write_empty?
methods.description: Checks if the write disposition for the job is WRITE_EMPTY, which provides the following behavior: If the table already exists and contains data, the job will have an error. This is the default write disposition for copy jobs.
